name: Embraer 170 Full Flight Detroit (DTW) to Lexington (LEX)
description:
Thanks for watching this Full Flight Experience!  After a brief visit with family, my sister and I were ready to head home.  The second and final of our return flights left from Detroit Metropolitan Airport (DTW) on a regional jet to our final destination, Blue Grass Airport (LEX) in Lexington, Kentucky.   

DTW is a large commercial hub, and traversing it is both easy and enjoyable.  After a brief tour of the terminal, we’ll taxi and takeoff into clear skies alongside Lake Erie.  After smooth flying across western Ohio, we’ll descend into Lexington in the wake of an autumn storm, making for a bumpy approach and landing.
Thanks for stopping by and I hope you enjoy! 

--------------------------------

Flight Information
Airline: Delta Connection (Shuttle America)
Flight Number: DL5296
Date of Flight: Sunday, October 2nd, 2016

Origin Airport: Lehigh Valley International Airport (KABE/ABE)
Destination Airport: Detroit Metropolitan Airport (KDTW/DTW)

Departing Gate: A67
Scheduled Departure: 17:40 EDT
Actual Departure from Gate: 17:35 EDT
Takeoff Runway and Time: RWY 22L / 17:44 EDT
Landing Runway and Time: RWY 22 / 18:31 EDT
Scheduled Arrival: 18:57 EDT
Actual Arrival at Gate: 18:36 EDT
Arriving Gate: B6

--------------------------------

Aircraft Information
Type: Embraer E170
Registration: N872RW 
Aircraft Delivery: September 2006 (Shuttle America in June 2011)
Engines: 2x GE CF34
Seat: 17A

--------------------------------

Video Highlights and Timeline
01:45 – Boarding
03:30 – Takeoff
05:30 – Initial Descent
08:00 – Final Approach
08:50 – Landing and Taxi
10:45 – Gate Arrival and Deplaning

--------------------------------

Gear
Nikon D3200/18-55mm lens
LP Microphone
GO PRO Hero
